entry.def: If you are frightened, you are anxious or afraid, often because of something that has just happened or that you think may happen.

example.ex: Miriam was too frightened to tell her family what had happened.
example.tran: 米丽娅姆太害怕了，不敢告诉家人发生了什么事。

means.word_mean: 1. thrown into a state of intense fear or desperation;

sentences.sentence: "trying to keep back the panic-stricken crowd"
"the frightened child cowered in the corner"

Sentence.sentence: The editor is frightened by this news, but he is more frightened by the idea of losing his newspaper, so he agrees to sign.
The editor is frightened by this news, but he is more frightened by the idea of losing his newspaper, so he agrees to sign.

One of the greatest heartbreaks for fire fighters occurs when they fail to rescue a child from a burning building because the child, frightened by smoke and noise, hides under a bed or in a closet and is later found dead.
Frightened victims can rarely make correct identification.
Perhaps we are even a bit frightened we may get like that, so we laugh.

sentences.en: The child is frightened of dogs.
